title: A Crisis of Confidence for ICE and Border Patrol as Clashes Escalate
summary: Current and former officials describe growing frustration and disillusionment with the Trump administration’s approach, even as they support the goal of immigration enforcement.

title: Alex Pretti’s Friends and Family Denounce ‘Sickening Lies’ About His Life
summary: People who knew a man fatally shot by federal agents pushed back against what they called a smear campaign by federal officials. “He was a good man,” his family said.

title: How the Trump Administration Rushed to Judgment in Minneapolis Shooting
summary: The administration was in a race to control the narrative around the killing of Alex Pretti, even as videos emerged that contradicted the government’s account.

title: Trump Administration Tries to Control Minneapolis Shooting Narrative, and Winter Storm Shatters Records
summary: Plus, High January is the new Dry January.

title: Storm Dumps a Foot of Snow in at Least 17 U.S. States
summary: Bonito Lake, N.M., received 31 inches, the most in the country, the National Weather Service said

title: Mamdani Clears Early Hurdles as Storm Bears Down on New York
summary: Mayor Zohran Mamdani made use of his strong communication skills, and the Sanitation Department said every road was plowed at least twice by Sunday evening.

title: Scenes From the Winter Storm
summary: Images from across much of the country illuminate snow-covered streets and preparations for worse still to come.

title: In Xi’s China, Top General’s Fall Shows Precariousness of Power
summary: A combat veteran, Zhang Youxia was once seen as the most trusted man in Xi Jinping’s military. Now he is the most public example of disloyalty to Mr. Xi.

title: Trump Hobbled the I.R.S. This C.E.O. Now Has to Make It Work.
summary: Frank Bisignano is the first chief executive of the I.R.S., where there’s hope he will end a chaotic stretch at the agency. The tax filing season, which started Monday, is his first test.

title: As Europe’s Reliance on U.S. Natural Gas Grows, So Does Trump’s Leverage
summary: Tension over Greenland has prompted worries that the Trump administration could turn the U.S. oil and gas industry into a way to pressure Europe.

title: In ‘Memory of a Killer,’ Patrick Dempsey Takes the Wheel
summary: The actor has spent a decade dismantling his McDreamy persona from “Grey’s Anatomy.” He stars as an assassin in a new Fox thriller.

title: Voters See a Middle-Class Lifestyle as Drifting Out of Reach, Poll Finds
summary: Concerns about the affordability of education, housing, health care, having a family and retirement are driving economic anxieties, a New York Times/Siena poll found.

title: Brisk Sales at Goodwill Suggest Wary Shoppers in an Uncertain Economy
summary: Consumers are still spending, but they’re looking for ways to stretch their dollars as far as possible.

title: Elon Musk’s X Faces EU Inquiry Over Sexualized AI Images Generated by Grok
summary: Regulators said the company’s lack of controls had led to the widespread use of deepfakes created with the chatbot Grok.

title: Yann LeCun, an A.I. Pioneer, Warns the Tech ‘Herd’ Could Hit a Dead End
summary: Yann LeCun helped create the technology behind today’s chatbots. Now he says many tech companies are on the wrong path to creating intelligent machines.

title: Silicon Valley Wants to Build A.I. That Can Improve A.I. on Its Own
summary: Ricursive Intelligence, founded by two former Google researchers and valued at $4 billion, is among several efforts to automate the creation of artificial intelligence.

title: A Winter Lull in the Fighting? Not in the Age of Drone Warfare.
summary: Shifts in tactics and technology in Ukraine mean that the pace of fighting is no longer decided by whether tanks can navigate frozen fields.

title: Gunmen Kill 11 After Soccer Match in Mexico
summary: The mass shooting occurred in an area fought over by drug cartels, just as the Mexican government has sought to show Washington that it is combating criminal groups.

title: In Venezuela, Freeing the Economy, but Nothing Else
summary: Interim leader Delcy Rodríguez is liberalizing the economy without dismantling her predecessor’s repressive apparatus, raising questions about her aims.

title: The Taliban Say They’re Ready to Release U.S. Prisoners. But Which Ones?
summary: Top Afghan officials say they want two American detainees released “as soon as possible,” but the Trump administration says a third one should be included.

title: How One Food Critic Overcame His Negative Relationship With Alcohol and Sugary Drinks
summary: In the last part of a monthlong series, Pete Wells and experts suggest how to sidestep the perils of alcoholic or sugary beverages.

title: ‘We Are Creating the Conditions for a Catastrophe.’ Three Columnists on the Shooting of Alex Pretti in Minneapolis.
summary: On immigration raids, the shooting death of Alex Pretti and where we go from here.

title: Local Prosecution Is the Answer to Federal Lawlessness
summary: State and local prosecutions could produce deterrent effects that are so desperately needed now.

title: Columbia Selects University of Wisconsin Chancellor as Its President
summary: Jennifer Mnookin has led the flagship campus of the state university system since 2022. She takes the helm at Columbia after a tumultuous period.

title: Private Jet With 8 People Aboard Crashes at Maine Airport, F.A.A. Says
summary: A Bombardier Challenger 600 crashed during takeoff at the Bangor airport, according to officials, as a paralyzing winter storm lashed the East Coast.

title: Pedro Lives in a Hospital. His Nurses Are on Strike. He Misses Them.
summary: Pedro, a 2-year-old, needs a new heart and has spent months in a New York hospital. With his nurses on the picket line, replacement workers care for him.
